title: ✚ Partial Data Reflections
description: This week, I have a new tutorial for you and then we get into using data with baggage.Tags: government, uncertainty
author: Nathan Yau
excerpt: This week, I have a new tutorial for you and then we get into using data with baggage.
text: It’s been a messy week on the data front. Well, messy on a lot of fronts. This is the Process, the newsletter for FlowingData members where we talk visualization, from the data on up. This week, I have a new tutorial for you and then we get into using data with baggage. To access this issue of The Process, you must be a member. (If you are already a member, log in here.) The Process is a weekly newsletter on how visualization tools, rules, and guidelines work in practice. I publish every Thursday. Get it in your inbox or read it on FlowingData. You also gain unlimited access to hundreds of hours worth of step-by-step visualization courses and tutorials, which will help you make sense of data for insight and presentation. Resources include source code and datasets so that you can more easily apply what you learn in your own work. Your support keeps the rest of FlowingData open and assures the data keeps flowing freely.
html:
It’s been a messy week on the data front. Well, messy on a lot of fronts. This is the Process, the newsletter for FlowingData members where we talk visualization, from the data on up. This week, I have a new tutorial for you and then we get into using data with baggage.

To access this issue of The Process, you must be a member. (If you are already a member, log in here.)

The Process is a weekly newsletter on how visualization tools, rules, and guidelines work in practice. I publish every Thursday. Get it in your inbox or read it on FlowingData.

You also gain unlimited access to hundreds of hours worth of step-by-step visualization courses and tutorials, which will help you make sense of data for insight and presentation. Resources include source code and datasets so that you can more easily apply what you learn in your own work.

Your support keeps the rest of FlowingData open and assures the data keeps flowing freely.
